title: Atomic Layer Etching Process
description: Schema for defining parameters and stages in an Atomic Layer Etching (ALE) process

processType.description: Type of ALE process, either plasma-based or thermal.

material.description: Material that is etched, such as W or WO3.

directionality.description: Specifies if the etching is anisotropic or isotropic.

reactants.description: List of reactants used in the ALE process, including metal precursors and etchants such as BCl3 and HF.

processParameters.description: Process parameters used during the ALE process

flowRate.description: Flow rate of reactants during the ALE process, measured in standard cubic centimeters per minute (sccm).

pressure.description: Pressure inside the reactor during the ALE process, measured in pascals.

substrate.description: Type of substrate used in the ALE process.

substrateTemperature.description: Temperature of the substrate during the ALE process, measured in Celsius.

reactor.description: Reactor where the ALE process is performed.

plasmaPower.description: Power of plasma used in plasma-enhanced ALE, measured in watts.

dosingTimes.description: Dosing times for reactants, measured in seconds.

purgingTimes.description: Purging times between reactant doses, measured in seconds.

numberOfCyclesToSaturation.description: Number of ALE cycles required to reach saturation.

massLossPerCycle.description: Mass loss during one or more cycles, measured by Quartz Crystal Microbalance (QCM) in micrograms.

temperatureWindow.description: Temperature range in Celsius for the ALE process, for which the sub-cycles are self-limiting.

ionEnergyWindow.description: Range of ion energies used in anisotropic ALE processes, measured in electronvolts (eV).

etchPerCycle.description: Etch rate per cycle, measured as nanometers per cycle.

synergy.description: Synergy factor indicating the effectiveness of alternating sub-cycles. Should be between 0 and 1, with 1 being an ideal ALE process and 0 indicating no synergy.

etchedMaterialProperties.description: Properties of the material after etching.

surfaceRoughness.description: Surface roughness of the etched material, measured in nanometers.

characterizationMethod.description: Method used to characterize the etched material, such as Raman spectroscopy, X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), and atomic force microscopy (AFM).

uniformity.description: Uniformity of the etching process across a wafer.

variance.description: Variance in etch rate across the wafer.

chemicalComposition.description: Chemical composition of the etched material, specifying elements such as W, O.

otherAspects.description: Other considerations such as safety, environmental impact, and process scalability.

safety.description: Safety considerations for the ALE process.

environmentalImpact.description: Environmental impact considerations for the ALE process.
